author: Ted Mann
title: Lawmakers Win Some Funding for New York-New Jersey Tunnel, But Standoff Remains
text:
WASHINGTON—Lawmakers from New York and New Jersey won hundreds of millions of dollars in new railroad funding in the omnibus spending bill. But that won’t break an impasse on their biggest railroad funding question: How to pay for a new tunnel under the Hudson River connecting the two states.
The omnibus bill would provide $650 million to Amtrak for capital projects along its busy Northeast Corridor rail line, an increase of $322 million from 2017. The new funding would enable the railroad to contribute $388 million to infrastructure...
